Sentencas: An energy-efficient and low-emissions solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) combined heat and power (CHP) system is a promising electric and thermal energy generation technology for implementation in future commercial buildings.
Titulo: Potential of SOFC CHP systems for energy-efficient commercial buildings

Sentencas: Recently developed performance models for kW- and MW-sized SOFC CHP systems have been integrated into a building energy simulation model of a medium-sized (7000 m(2)) office building to evaluate the potential of the system to lower annual utility costs and to reduce CO2 emissions.
Titulo: Potential of SOFC CHP systems for energy-efficient commercial buildings

Sentencas: An optimized 175 kW SOFC CHP system successfully lowered annual utility costs by up to 14.5% over a baseline HVAC system in locations with space heating-dominant loads.
Titulo: Potential of SOFC CHP systems for energy-efficient commercial buildings

Sentencas: Potential CO2 emissions were reduced by up to 62% over the baseline case for the optimized SOFC CHP systems.
Titulo: Potential of SOFC CHP systems for energy-efficient commercial buildings

Sentencas: If the capital and installation costs of SOFC CHP systems are reduced in the near future, through the realization of cheaper, high-performance intermediate temperature SOFCs, the SOFC CHP system may be a promising energy-efficient and low-emitting alternative power and thermal energy cogeneration technology.
Titulo: Potential of SOFC CHP systems for energy-efficient commercial buildings
